events.name: Google Cast Codelab + Hack & Learn
events.description:
You always wanted to show cool stuff on your big TV? Or you have an iOS/Android app/website and you want to give your users the possibility to show things on the big screen?
Now is the chance to get to know how you can get Chromecast devices to do what you want!

We'll show you how to get the first 'hello world' running on the TV! After that you'll be free to hack whatever you want - whether it is a game, a video player, a dashboard showing your build statistics or a twitter wall - let your imagination flow! :)

And after that, maybe you might take one of the Chromecasts with you‚Ä¶ ;)

Some coding experience required (iOS, Android or web) - and you'll need to bring your laptop with you. We'll organize the Chromecasts and pizza!
Be quick - space is limited!

events.name: GDG Rhein-Main Regular Meetup August 2015
events.description:
It's time for our next cool GDG meetup! There will be marshmallows. How many of them can you put in your mouth and say 'chubby bunny'? Just kidding. ;)
There is lots of new cool stuff to talk about. Android Marshmallow is nearly finished and we're really interested what you have been cooking in the last 2 months. :)
Join in for an evening full of nerdiness, beer and fun!

As always we meet at the Yours Australian Bar near Hauptwache in Frankfurt. See you on Wednesday! :)

events.name: GDG Rhein-Main Regular Meetup September 2015
events.description:
Our next regular GDG meetup is next Wednesday, and timing couldn't be better! The new Android Marshmallow will be out, and 2 Nexii, and the new Chromecast, and maybe more? What better time than to enjoy all the tech awesomeness together with a nice cold beer?

Join in for an evening full of nerdiness, beer and fun!

As always we meet at the Yours Australian Bar near Hauptwache in Frankfurt. See you on Wednesday! :)

events.name: GDG Rhein-Main Regular Meetup October 2015
events.description:
Come to our meetup next Wednesday!¬†

Join in for an evening full of nerdiness, beer and fun and show what you built!

Also, we're kicking off the orga of our next talk time event, and we're looking for your ideas on talks and demos!

As always we meet at the Yours Australian Bar near Hauptwache in Frankfurt. See you on Wednesday! :)

https://plus.google.com/events/clqlpudddkq529vujaog5d0ugr8

events.name: GDG Rhein-Main Christmas Talk Time 2015
events.description:
"So here it is, merry christmas, everybody is having fun‚Ä¶"

And what would be a christmas without a nice GDG talk time?
Join us on the 8th December on the top-most floor of the Silvertower in Frankfurt for a nerdy christmas event full of talks, networking and fun!

Livestream available:¬†http://stream.cafe/live/

In cooperation with Techettes Frankfurt, the Frankfurt Polymer group¬†and¬†Coding Night Frankfurt¬†we brought to you some sweet talks about diverse topics in the tech universe:

Ronan Schwarz - Internet of Things with LoRa

LoRa is a technology and specification for low power wide area networks. It allows small IoT devices to communicate at slow speeds, but over a wide range.

Marko Petzold - Polymer & Web Components

You want to use a new HTML element, but browser vendors need years to agree on a standard? Today, you can create HTML elements yourself using web components!
Polymer is just the tool to help you out here. It helps you create elements easier and comes with some quite handy features like 2-way data binding. To top it off, Polymer comes with a lot of pre-built nice-looking material designed elements, so you can start in a jiffy!

Harini Gunabalan: Machine Learning with TensorFlow

Google recently published the open-source application TensorFlow, a¬†new machine learning system that was built on top of the machine learning knowledge within Google.
Today, TensorFlow is used for building algorithms used for speech recognition, smart reply or search in photos.

Theofilos Nikolaou: Project Tango

What if your phone could not only see, but also recognize the world around you? That's what Project Tango is all about. It allows devices to measure depth around them. Moreover, it can build full 3D models of the real environment.
Theofilos is going to show us what Tango is and what it does - including a live demo!

Michal Harakal -¬†Docker for Android Developers

Docker as an open platform for building, shipping and running distributed applications is gaining a lot of momentum. Especially part "building" can be very interesting for Android developers. By dealing with various IDEs, build systems, build tools, libraries, Android API and so on Docker can be a quite handy helper in developer's toolbox. We will have a short look what Docker is, will show some use cases related to Android development and share experiences from our daily life.

Now, do we have your attention? :-)

Please register upfront so the¬†so the skyscraper security is going to let you upstairs, and places are limited! See you soon!

Livestream available:¬†http://stream.cafe/live/

Agenda:

¬† 17:30 ¬† ¬†Enter the building
¬† 18:00 ¬† ¬†Start of talks
~21:00 ¬† Open end, beer, socializing, fun & more!

events.name: GDG Rhein-Main Regular Meetup January 2016
events.description:
Let's kick off the new year 2016 together! Join us, have a beer, show what you have been up to lately and have fun!

Next wednesday, we'll try out the Waxy's Irish Pub for a change - which is directly where the Your's Australian Bar is. ;-)
And as a plus, we'll invite the Polymer User Group Frankfurt¬†for a chat about new & hot web components! :-)

See you on Wednesday in the Waxy's, near Hauptwache Frankfurt!Ôªø

https://plus.google.com/b/100306385846086409727/events/cm5feeuk66o5ogt82ufq7l8f1jk

events.name: GDG Rhein-Main Regular Meetup February/March 2016
events.description:
This time we meet out of schedule on the first Wednesday of March - again at the Yours Australian Bar near Hauptwache, Frankfurt.

Also, we're kicking off the organization for our next talk time: Android Tool Time! We like to know what libraries or tools you love using the most during your coding time. What about OkHttp, Dagger2 or EventBus? Android Studio 2.0, the new emulator or something completely magically?

Meet us to enjoy an evening full of fun, tech, nerdiness and beer! See you on Wednesday! :)

events.name: GDG Rhein-Main Regular Meetup April 2016
events.description:
Oh my, only 23 days until the next Google I/O conference starts! Let's make our last 'Stammtisch' before I/O. What do you think will be announced? What do you wish for?

We'll meet out of schedule on Thursday at 7PM in the Waxy's Irish Pub near Frankfurt Hauptwache. Also, you will have the chance to drink a beer together with our sponsor of the next I/O Extended - 7P! :)

Meet us to enjoy an evening full of fun, tech, nerdiness and beer! See you on Thursday! :)

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2016
events.description:
The Google I/O conference 2016 will happen starting on 18th of May! We will live-stream the keynote so you can experience the latest & greatest announcements in Android, Chrome and bad-ass crazy tech like self-driving cars, virtual reality, Internet of Things and more.

Please give big cheers to SEVEN PRINCIPLES AG, which is hosting the event and also will provide food & drinks for attendees! :-D

Please RSVP to the event to save your place - to join us on an evening full of tech, nerdiness and fun!

Bonus talk

Live Coding ‚Äì Easily collaborate on and create RESTful interface with swagger¬†

This session will cover how developers can collaborate in creating a RESTful API specification, generate mock services and client implementations. Furthermore you‚Äôll see how backend developers can generate automated documentation for their APIs.
From the swagger folks:A powerful interface for you APISwagger is a simple yet powerful representation of your RESTful API. With the largest ecosystem of API tooling on the planet, thousands of developers are supporting Swagger in almost every modern programming language and deployment environment. With a Swagger-enabled API, you get interactive documentation, client SDK generation and discoverability.We created Swagger to help fulfill the promise of APIs. Swagger helps companies like Apigee, Getty Images, Intuit, LivingSocial, McKesson, Microsoft, Morningstar, and PayPal build the best possible services with RESTful APIs.

Many thanks to¬†Manuel Weidmann.

Agenda:

‚Ä¢ 6:00 PM : Event open

‚Ä¢¬†6:20 PM : Talk / live demo on swagger (until ~6:45)

‚Ä¢ 7:00 PM : I/O keynote with the latest & greatest in technology!

‚Ä¢ ~ 9:30 PM: Socializing, beer & chill out
events.how_to_find_us: SEVEN PRINCIPLES AG, Solmsstra√üe 4, near Frankfurt West train station

events.name: Post-I/O GDG Meetup
events.description:
Did you enjoy the Google I/O? Or didn't you keep track of all the sessions, and you want to know which videos to put on your YouTube watchlist? Then come to our one-and-only post-I/O meetup, have a beer and let's see which sessions you should definitely have a look at!
So many cool new things: a giant new Firebase tool set, awesome updates to Android Studio, ChromeOS and much more. A smartwatch that can sense gestures via the Soli sensor, a voice assistant for your home and new apps for messaging and video chat. Also, a new Android-based VR platform named Daydream...
Join on Thursday at Waxy's Irish Pub near Hauptwache Frankfurt and have a lot of fun! :)

events.name: Android Tool Time Frankfurt
events.description:
We have something really special coming up!

Learn more about the favorite tools other Android devs use! Which libraries, applications, features or more do they enjoy?

Each tool gets a spotlight time of¬†5 minutes. That way we only show the best parts and it won't get boring! ¬† :-)

You know a tool that you really enjoy and you just can't wait to show it to others?
Tell us which one!¬†https://bit.ly/tool-time-topics
First come, first serve basis.

We'll meet on 12th of July in the Silvertower upstairs on the SkyDeck! Big thanks to DB Systel for hosting this awesome event location!
As always, don't forget to RSVP to the event because we have to get you through security.

Follow us on Twitter to see the agenda unfold ‚Äì we will announce the topics as they arrive!

Agenda:

¬† ¬† 6:30pm: ¬† Doors open
¬† ¬† 7:00pm: ¬† Crazy Android Tool Time!¬†First topics:

OkHttp

Android Databinding

Profiling with Android Studio

Test coverage for POJOs

jsonschema2pojo

Jenkins Job DSL Plugin

EventBus

SyncAdapter

Your loved tool is missing? Add it!¬†https://bit.ly/tool-time-topics

¬† ¬† ??pm: ¬† Android Dev + Beer Time ‚Äì get to know each other and beer! :)

The awesome location is again sponsored by DB Systel, which will also provide some drinks. SANID GmbH will provide some beer to make the presentations more enjoyable. Big thanks to our two sponsors!

And pssst, they're hiring, too! ;)
http://www.dbsystel.de/dbsystel/karriere/
https://www.sanid.com/jobs/
events.how_to_find_us: The Silvertower is in walking distance of Frankfurt Hbf. You can also walk from Frankfurt Willy-Brandt-Platz. The event is happening upstairs at the 'SkyDeck'.

events.name: Android Nougat Launch Party
events.description:
It's time! We'll celebrate the new Android Nougat with a few beers (I'll also bring Nougat!) and our typical nerdy techy conversations! Also, who started using Kotlin yet and can tell from experience?

This time we'll meet on Thursday at Waxy's Irish Pub near Hauptwache Frankfurt. Nougat party, yay! :)

events.name: Pixel Party
events.description:
Google will launch something new on October 4th, and they started a world-wide marketing campaign to tease the launch. For example in Munich:

Some tweets suggest that it will be huge:

What will we see? A new pixel phone? A new system named 'Andromeda', which combines Chrome OS and Android? The new Google Home, Google WiFi and a new tablet?

We can't wait to find out! And if you're like us, let's meet next Tuesday at Waxy's Irish Pub near Hauptwache to celebrate the launch! :-D

events.name: Gl√ºhwein Developer Group: Christmas Time!
events.description:
This Thursday we will rename our Google Developer Group to Gl√ºhwein Developer Group! We'll meet at 7PM in front of Waxy's Irish Pub, go to the Christmas market near Hauptwache and enjoy some hot delicious Gl√ºhwein!

Then, later at 8PM we go back to Waxy's to finish the evening with more drinks, food and techy topics! Android Things was just announced (I'll bring my Raspberry Pi 3 running Android Things), and if someone could bring a Google Home device maybe we can train it to recognize 'Ok Gl√ºhwein'. :-)

events.name: Kickoff 2017
events.description:
It's been a long time! Let's kickoff this year with a GDG meetup about machine learning, self-driving cars and more! Also let's share stuff about your favorite languages - Kotlin, Dart, you name it!

We will meet at Waxy's Irish pub near Hauptwache, Frankfurt.

See you there! :)

events.name: I/O Extended 2017 Frankfurt
events.description: Keynote Live viewing and get together with codelabs networking and lots of fun!

events.name: Mid-summer GDG-meetup!
events.description:
Our regular get together for networking, socializing and discussing the things we like about Google's technologies!

As usual we meet at Waxy's Irish pub near Hauptwache, Frankfurt.

See you there! :)

PS. I reserved a table for 5 knowing that it is summer season and many people are on vacation.¬†Please try and RSVP and if I see *overwhelming* response I will try to increase it and if not possible we just grab some beers and head for a park! :)

**UPDATE**

The reservation is now for 10 people (the maximum I could get with their online tool). Hopefully we will be able to squeeze in the extra people.

events.name: November GDG Meetup - It's about time!
events.description:
It has been a long time since our last meetup indeed!
A lot has happened:

‚Ä¢ Android 8.0 Oreo has been released

‚Ä¢¬†New Google Home devices!

‚Ä¢ The power of web components at your fingertips (soon in all browsers)

So let's meet, have a beer and talk about everything that has happened and the tech stuff you care about!

As usual we meet at Waxy's Irish pub near Hauptwache, Frankfurt.

See you there! :)

events.name: Kotlin Night Frankfurt - by GDG + Kotlin Rhein-Main
events.description:
GDG Rhein-Main and Kotlin Rhein-Main are proud to announce:
Kotlin Night is coming to Frankfurt! üéâ

Whether you are new to Kotlin or already have tons of experience: We want to bring together the whole Kotlin community around Frankfurt for a big get-together! Many thanks to our sponsors: compeople AG for catering as well as transportation of some of our speakers, and DB Systel for the great location up in the Frankfurt sky!

Talks:
- Dr. Holger Brandl: "Building Data Science Workflows & Libraries with Kotlin"
- Niklas Lochschmidt & Marc Reichelt: "Replace Java with Kotlin for fun and profit (Backend Edition)"
- Simon Wirtz: "Coping with Kotlin's Scope Functions"

Want to work on a project with Kotlin? We will do a round of *Kotlin project pitches*! Here up to 10 developers will get 3 minutes each to present what cool project using Kotlin they are working on at their company. Think 'job offers', but without the recruiters - and with people you can ask real questions later on!
_If you want to pitch a project, a company or an open source project, please contact us in advance! Remember: pitches are limited, and this is a great opportunity to reach new Kotlin developers!_

Doors are open at 18:30 and the event will start at 19:00.
It's very important that you RSVP with your full name and come to the location on time, because we need to get you through security!

--
Kotlin Night Frankfurt is proudly sponsored by:
compeople AG - https://www.compeople.de
DB Systel - https://www.dbsystel.de
JetBrains - https://www.jetbrains.com

events.name: April GDG Meetup - Tech, networking & fun!
events.description:
After a legendary Kotlin Night we decided to do a smaller (but cozy) regular GDG meetup in April.
We'll meet again at the Waxy's Irish Pub near Hauptwache, Frankfurt.

Join us on a night full of fun, networking, a few drinks and of course your latest favorite tech news! :-)

events.name: Google I/O Extended Frankfurt 2018
events.description:
It's that time again! The big Google I/O conference is coming up, and we're livestreaming the keynote! Join us and get excited about all the new things that we don't know about yet.
Will it be Android Pie, Peanut Butter or Pickles? Find out! A new breakthrough in VR? That'd be cool. A totally new operating system based on Flutter? Why not! Kotlin for iOS? PWAs coming to the Play Store? A new Material Design? Next-generation AI? A voice assistant that truly understands you?
Alright - let's stop speculating and find out together!

Agenda:
18:30: Open doors & grab your seats
19:00: Google Keynote
21:45: Developer Keynote
23:00: OMG this is late why not some beer and networking ;)

What are you waiting for? RSVP now to reserve your seat! And we'll update this Meetup as new information comes in - a little birdy told us there will be one more thing‚Ä¶

events.name: Summer GDG Meetup - Tech, networking & fun!
events.description:
It's summer time! Sun, a refreshing beer and of course your latest tech news. What could be better?
We'll meet again at the Waxy's Irish Pub near Hauptwache, Frankfurt.

Whether it's Android, Web, Kotlin, Backend, Flutter or VR: We're always in for a good talk!
Come and join in on the fun! :-)

events.name: Hacktoberfest Frankfurt 2018
events.description:
Welcome to Hacktoberfest Frankfurt 2018

Celebrate open source over food, drinks, and great company! Hacktoberfest is all about encouraging meaningful contributions to the open source ecosystem. You do not need to be a developer or know code to participate. Come along to learn how you can become an open source contributor!

More info: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hacktoberfest-frankfurt-2018-tickets-50225231018?aff=gdgrheinmain

This is a joint community event by CSS Frankfurt, Vue.js Frankfurt, Angular Frankfurt, Women Techmakers Rhein-Main, Techettes Frankfurt, Code Review, Frankfurt Data Science, ASP.NET Core Rhein Main, GDG Rhein-Main and more!

Sponsored by melsicon GmbH and Rocketloop.

events.name: DACHFest 2018 (DevFest DACH)
events.description:
For this year's DevFest season, GDG and WTM communities of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland are all working together to organize our largest event yet: DACHFest!

DACHFest is a two-day DevFest conference focused on making a difference. Meet technology experts in emerging fields like AR/VR and Voice UI, discover all the different ways in which technology is transforming lives, find out how to make your apps and websites accessible and friendly towards everyone, learn the secrets of building and nurturing a diverse community ‚Äî let our speakers surprise and inspire you! And don't forget to make new friends: there will be plenty of opportunities to meet people passionate about your favourite things. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Join us in Munich on November 10‚Äì11 for two days full of talks, workshops, showcases, networking, and fun!

DACHFest is a paid event, but diversity scholarships are available for people who belong to underrepresented groups in tech or cannot afford a ticket.

Website: https://dachfest.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/dachfest

events.name: #FlutterLive Viewing Party
events.description: Join us for a Livestream of the Flutter Live 2018 Keynote. Get the latest updates and news on Flutter, the Open-Source SDK for Cross-Platform Apps.

events.name: GDG Christmas Special
events.description:
It's time to meet for our GDG Christmas special! If some hot Gl√ºhwein (of course hot Punsch works as well) and just the right amount of tech sounds like a good combination to you: that's exactly what we will do next Wednesday! ‚õÑüõ∑üéÑ

We'll meet at 7 at Waxy's Irish pub and then walk to the Frankfurt Christmas Market to have some fun.
Don't worry if you can't make it on time: just write us and we'll share our location so you can join in!

See you next Wednesday! And you might get surprised :-)

events.name: Flutter Coding Session
events.description:
Together with https://www.meetup.com/Frankfurt-Flutterers-Meetup/ we present the next Flutter Meetup. This Time we will do some Hands-On Coding.
We recommend to install the Flutter SDK beforehand, see https://flutter.io/docs/get-started/install .

We'll have some Pizza & Drinks for you to keep the energy up.

Come plenty and join our journey into Flutter.
events.how_to_find_us: Westbahnhof is the nearest S-Bahn station (5mins). The nearest U-bahn station is about 12min away (Bockenheimer Warte). When you get to the building just ring the doorbell which is located near a Curved-looking door and we will open it for you

events.description:
It's that time again! We're proud to announce another Google I/O Extended, together with our friends over at Women Techmakers Rhein-Main! üéâ

The big Google I/O conference is coming up, and we're livestreaming üé¨ the keynote! Join us and get excited about all the new things that we don't know about yet.

What are you waiting for? RSVP now to reserve your seat! A little birdy üê§ told us there might be Pizza! üçï

Thanks a lot to our sponsor this year: iteratec GmbH! They provide us with a really awesome location üèôÔ∏è with a view üî≠ over Frankfurt, as well as catering. You can find more about them (and they're hiring!) here: https://www.iteratec.de/

events.how_to_find_us: Up on the 17th floor, company "iteratec GmbH"

events.name: Google Cloud (Special guest: Emma Haruka Iwao)
events.description:
**IMPORTANT** Please register yourself on the meetup page of Women Techmakers, so we only have to keep track of a single RSVP list: https://www.meetup.com/Women-Techmakers-Frankfurt_Rhein-Main/events/261480601/
Thank you!

Cancel your plans for the evening of June 18th, because we have something special coming up for you! Together with our friendly Women Techmakers, we are proud to bring the Google Cloud to the Frankfurt "Wolkenkratzer" Cloud! And we are honoured to welcome Emma Haruka Iwao of Google, as well as two more talks about Docker, Kubernetes, and the cloud! üéâ

Thanks a lot to our sponsor, DB Systel, for providing us with an awesome location at the top floor of the Silvertower! üëè
And we are proud that Google sponsors food & drinks at that evening, as well as providing an amazing speaker for us! üëè

6:30 - Doors Open & Networking (Snacks + Drinks)
7:00 - Welcome from WTM Frankfurt & GDG Rhein-Main
7:10 - Overview how Cloud is fast forwarding our tech opportunities (Emily J. Ryan, Google Cloud Enablement)
7:30 - Docker & Kubernetes (Ronan, GDG)
8:00 - Our Special guest Emma Haruka Iwao*
8:40 - Networking

*) Emma Haruka Iwao is a Japanese computer scientist and cloud developer advocate at Google. In 2019 Haruka Iwao calculated the world's most accurate value of pi (œÄ); which included 31.4 trillion digits, far past the previous record of 22 trillion.
Iwao joined Google as a Cloud Developer Advocate in 2015. She originally worked for Google in Tokyo, before moving to Seattle in 2019. Iwao offers training in the use of the Google Cloud Platform (GCP), as well as supporting application developers. She works to make cloud computing accessible for everyone, creating online demos and teaching materials.

**IMPORTANT** Please register yourself on the meetup page of Women Techmakers, so we only have to keep track of a single RSVP list: https://www.meetup.com/Women-Techmakers-Frankfurt_Rhein-Main/events/261480601/
Thank you!

upcoming.name: Summer GDG Meetup - Tech, networking & fun!
upcoming.description:
It's summer time! Sun, a refreshing beer and of course your latest tech news. What could be better?
We'll meet again at the Waxy's Irish Pub near Hauptwache, Frankfurt.

A lot has happened since our last Stammtisch: Android Q 5 Beta is out, Flutter 1.7 as well, and Kotlin is now the primary language for Android development (but so much more!).
Whether it's Android, Web, Kotlin, Cloud, Flutter or VR: We're always in for a good talk!
Come and join in on the fun! :-)

organizers.name: zero

organizers.name: Marc R.
organizers.bio: Developer. Loves Linux, open source & self-driving cars. Making the world better, one step at a time!

group_profile.intro:
Developer. Loves Linux, enjoys Android and open source in general.
Making the world better, one step at a time!

Linux, Android and Java lover and Google fan.
Trying everyday for the best while following the motto:
Don't submit to stupid rules. Be yourself and not a fool
Don't accept average habits. Open your heart and push the limits
